sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
Find the determinant of the following 2x2 matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 7 \\ 3 & 2 \end{bmatrix}
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, we use the formula:

det(A) = ad - bc

where A is the given matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}

In this case, a = 5, b = 7, c = 3, and d = 2. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

det(A) = (5)(2) - (7)(3) = 10 - 21 = -11

So, the determinant of the given matrix is -11.
